Qa.title: Types of Blockchain Development
Qa.desc: One of the most important things to think about when first digitizing firms is business process automation. To transform the workspace, this can be accomplished by merging robotic process automation, artificial intelligence, and remote desktop automation on a single platform.
Qa.decs: It is usually beneficial to combine digital capabilities with potential business experiences when changing the value chain of a corporation. To get the best results, a vision-led consultative approach is aided by our DPA (Digital Process Automation) services.

Whycomfygen.title: Blockchain
Whycomfygen.desc: A public blockchain is available for anyone in the world to read and send transactions. Cryptoeconomics secure the public blockchain, and this type of blockchain is highly transparent and democratic. The public blockchain is perfectly suitable for online marketplaces and cryptocurrency trading.

Whycomfygen.title: Private Blockchain
Whycomfygen.desc: Unlike a public blockchain, in this type of blockchain, all the crucial decisions are made by the central individual who can grant access or set a limit for other participating nodes. Transactions in private blockchain are comparatively cheaper as it requires verification from very few nodes. Private blockchain provides a great level of privacy.

Whycomfygen.title: Consortium Blockchain
Whycomfygen.desc: A collection of companies who regularly interact and conduct business use consortium blockchain. Because of its control and transparency, consortium blockchain is one of the most often utilized blockchains. Federated blockchains are another name for consortium blockchains.

Frequently.title: Are the blockchain developers working with you adaptable to new tools or systems?
Frequently.desc: Indeed! Making our end-of-services as adaptable as possible for our clients has been our regular procedure. Many of our clients required our assistance to improve their systems even if they already had a website or app.

Frequently.title: What is the price to employ a blockchain developer?
Frequently.desc: The cost of employing a blockchain developer is determined by a number of variables, namely the area from which the developer is being hired, the developer's experience and skill level, and the features and integrations you require. However, a rough estimate of the cost would be in the range of $5,000 and $30,000.

Frequently.title: How much does it cost to hire a blockchain developer?
Frequently.desc: The region from which the developer is being employed, the developer's experience and skill level, and the features and integrations you need are some of the factors that affect the cost of hiring a blockchain developer. But roughly speaking, the price would fall between $5,000 and $30,000.

Plateform.decs: Transaction speed acceleration, performance enhancement, and mistake reduction are the outcomes of embodied logic in smart contracts. Less middlemen and a distributed ledger system enable speedy transactions with low processing costs.

Indeed, it is possible to observe all of the completed transactions and holdings for each public address on the blockchain. Eliminate the trouble of looking for reports in several formats from different sources.
Authorization of transactions inside a chain is a must for all participants in a blockchain, as these applications foster increased confidence, improved trust, and ultimately, customer happiness.

The blockchain community is tenacious. Therefore, there is no room for malpractices like hacking and interception. While records in databases can be changed, on a blockchain, every record has a hash that is determined by squaring it with the hash of the record before it.
Blockchain technology is cost-efficient since it can assist in lowering transaction and operating costs. It has the potential to improve operational and process efficiency in business.

AppProcess.title: Conceptualization
AppProcess.decs: First we believe in knowing about our own product. Our agenda is very clear to understand and learn what clients want to build, and later jump into the marketplace to survey competitors to learn about their methods and strategies of success. Product Discovery and Product Research, these two things are significant help in knowing what we need to build.

AppProcess.title: Design
AppProcess.decs: Here our expert minds will use their creative side for UI/UX. We will do wireframing, prototyping, and add engaging aspects to make the users sustain the application. The designers believe in branding for your business or product through its engaging designs, and here you have that with us.

AppProcess.title: Development
AppProcess.decs: Now comes the coding, programming languages, adding features, and working on its functionalities. The mobile app developers will write their codes, work on application’s front-end and back-end, and also add required & additional features to make the app work according to the current marketplace standards.

AppProcess.title: Quality Assurance
AppProcess.decs: When the mobile application is built completely, afterwards the testers will do quality assurance to know if there are any bugs, technical technical glitches, or any other issue occurred. This is an important stage, where the team will identify issues and resolve them for best possible app delivery.

AppProcess.title: Deployment
AppProcess.decs: You must have decided on a dedicated mobile app deployment platform, either iOS AppStore or Android PlayStore to launch the app. Once the issues are resolved, then developers are supposed to launch your application on the dedicated mobile app deployment platform to market it forward.

AppProcess.title: Support and Maintenance
AppProcess.decs: We are responsible for the post-deployment services, which includes support and maintenance after launch. Our team of experts will alter applications based on the market standards and users needs. We will add on more features, change the algorithm, remove bugs, work on the feedback received, and serve more possible post deployment to make the app worth establishing in the marketplace.

Why.title: Why choose Comfygen for Mobile App Development Services?
Why.decs: We understand that promising words are not enough to fetch clients faith in our mobile app development services. Still we have something to say, proves that Comfygen will stand for client’s application standards and beat the market competitions with our agile developments:

Choose.title: Security is our Key
Choose.decs: We work on General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Network Information System Regulations, 114 best practices control, and Biannual External Security Audits. It is our most important priority to secure clients somehow, so that they can uniquely establish their app.

Choose.title: Transparency What Makes Us Stand
Choose.decs: We have learnt one thing from our experience, which is to be “Transparent” with clients. The clients proactively follow documentations, want to learn about productivity, high quality solution processing, and more. Our company and experts respect it, and follow the same transparency to gain their trust and more value in the market.

Choose.title: Cost Effective Solutions
Choose.decs: Our mobile app solutions are cost-effective. Do you want to know how? The reason is our knowledge and experience. We have the mind, who knows what is best for the app and business, what is beneficial, what is right, what is just an extra but not worth, and more. Their extensive knowledge is not a sign of extra expense, but it is a sign to have an extraordinary application in right costing.

Choose.title: Always Involved with New Tech-Trends
Choose.decs: You might have noticed nowadays that whoever is upgrading is leading the market. Same goes in all the domains / industries. If you want to lead, you have to upgrade to something new. We have the power, and grant the leverages to clients to meet current unique and latest tech-trends. Our super efficient minds are not only innovative, but adaptable to new things; which we imply in our projects to build great applications.

WhyChoose.title: Idea Generation and Planning
WhyChoose.decs: The mobile app development process typically begins with brainstorming and idea generation. Developers and stakeholders collaborate to identify the app's purpose, target audience, and key features. Planning involves outlining the app's functionality, user interface, and overall structure.

WhyChoose.title: Design and Prototyping
WhyChoose.decs: Once the concept is defined, designers create wireframes and prototypes to visualize the app's user interface (UI) and user experience (UX). This phase focuses on creating a design that is both aesthetically pleasing and user-friendly, ensuring a seamless interaction for the end-users.

WhyChoose.title: Development and Coding
WhyChoose.decs: The actual coding of the mobile app takes place during this phase. Developers use programming languages such as Java (for Android) or Swift (for iOS) to build the app's functionality. They work on integrating features, implementing back-end systems, and ensuring the app's compatibility with various devices and screen sizes.

WhyChoose.title: Testing
WhyChoose.decs: Rigorous testing is crucial to identify and rectify bugs, glitches, and usability issues. Quality Assurance (QA) teams perform various tests, including functionality testing, performance testing, and user acceptance testing. This phase ensures that the app meets the specified requirements and functions reliably across different devices.

WhyChoose.title: Deployment
WhyChoose.decs: After successful testing, the app is ready for deployment. Developers submit the app to the respective app stores (e.g., Apple App Store, Google Play Store) for review and approval. Once approved, the app becomes available for download and installation by users.

WhyChoose.title: Maintenance and Updates
WhyChoose.decs: The mobile app development process doesn't end with deployment. Continuous maintenance is essential to address user feedback, fix any emerging issues, and ensure compatibility with new devices or operating system updates. Developers also release periodic updates to introduce new features, enhance performance, and address security vulnerabilities.
